info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 29 at 2:41PM EDT until July 29 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Southern Bay County in the Florida Panhandle.
* WHEN...Until 345 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 139 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms is occurring and approaching Panama City. Heavy rainfall rates will lead to minor flooding shortly in the advisory area. - Be alert for worsening conditions should rainfall rates increase which could lead to the issuance of a flash flood warning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Panama City, Lynn Haven, Panama City Beach, Callaway, Springfield, Mexico Beach, Hiland Park, Tyndall Air Force Base, Parker, Dirego Park, Cedar Grove, Brannonville, Millville, College Station, Bay Harbor, Southport, Recota Beach, Bayou George, Magnolia Beach and Bayhead. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON
